thread.title: NU starts hard climb Games Today
thread.title_full: NU starts hard climb Games Today

author: Peter Atencio
title: NU starts hard climb Games Today
text:
NU starts hard climb Games Today NU starts hard climb Games Today By Peter Atencio | Oct. 10, 2015 at 12:01am 
THE National University Bulldogs still dream of a title-retention bid in the 78th University Athletic Association of the Philippines men’s basketball tournament. With the second round about to start, there is still hope for the Bulldogs. 
To get there, the Bulldogs will have to win every game, starting with their 4 p.m. encounter with the University of the East Warriors at the SM Mall of Asia Arena today.“Every game is crucial. We need every game we can get,” said Altamirano.The Red Warriors have lost their last four games, and head coach Derrick Pumaren said that they have been experiencing rough times. 
Earlier, Adamson (1-6) takes on University of the Philippines (2-5) at 2 p.m. This will be the second straight time the two teams face off, with the Maroons looking for ways to get back at the Falcons, who dealt them a 73-68 defeat just last week. Peter Atencio 
Games Today (Mall of Asia Arena, Pasay) 2 p.m. - UP vs AdU 4 p.m. - UE vs NU
